New Records: Shohei Ohtani became the first MLB player with 43 home runs and 43 stolen bases in the same season
Key Match Events: Ohtani achieved his 43rd stolen base in the second inning
Ohtani hit a 380-footer solo HR in the eighth inning
Pre-Game Insights: Manager Dave Roberts said Ohtani has bought into stealing bases and understands its value
Ohtani has invested time in learning the nuances of the running game with first-base coach Clayton McCullough
Post-Match Reflections: Ohtani remains on pace for the first 50-50 season in major-league history
With two more nights like Friday, Ohtani will match Rickey Henderson for the major-league record of most such games in a single season (13, in 1986)
